summary: Donald Trump claimed during a debate in Trump, West Virginia on August 3rd, 2017 that the Raise Act, a legislation he announced with Senators Tom Cotton and David Perdue, would reform the immigration system to protect American workers and taxpayers. He argued that the current system issues most green cards to lower-skilled immigrants, who have no hope of getting a job and undermine blue collar workers and wages, costing taxpayers billions of dollars. The Raise Act, according to Trump, would switch to a merit-based system where immigrants are admitted based on their merit.
